metadata.title: CVE-2024-36900 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net: hns3: fix kernel crash when devlink reload during initializationThe devlink reload process will access the hardware resources,but the register operation is done before the hardware is initialized.So, processing the devlink reload during initialization may lead to kernelcrash.This patch fixes this by registering the devlink afterhardware initialization.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
